result.execSummary:
The defendant Joe Vallin III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 15 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Defendant must register with the Sex Offender Registry and comply with all rules and requirements of the Sex Offender Registry.  Once sentence is complete, defendant must comply with lifetime Sex Offender Registry.  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including Sex Offender Treatment. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joe Vallin III

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of the circuit court is summarily affirmed. See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Angela Conrad Kachelski is relieved for further representation of Joe Vallin, III, in this appeal. See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

Jury question
#4 offered by the court only
Count 1 - GUILTY

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator), between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). No contact with minor children. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 8/26/14 Cond's to include no controlled substances unless prescribed. Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  May go to work, attorney appointments, court and treatment.**

**AMENDED 2/27/15 Allowed for work search at Workforce Development Center - must notify when he will be there.**

**AMENDED 3/24/15 Remove GPS, however defendant to be on SCRAM Unit - monitored through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).**

**AMENDED 8/3/15 MUST POST AN ADDITIONAL $200 BY FRIDAY AUGUST 7TH AT 5PM OR REPORT TO RACINE COUNTY JAIL**
